page.title: 18Dorset Coastal Path
page.content: The{Dorset Coastal Path}passes through this area. At the western end it passes by the nature reserve of Lodmoor, before rising up Jordan Hill with its Roman Temple. From this hill good views can be had of Lodmoor, Weymouth and Portland. Moving on the Path passes Bowleaze Cove with its holiday attractions. Here a detour has to be made to avoid the dangerous cliffs which are continually subsiding. The Path moves out of the built up area and into countryside rising towards Redcliffe Point, just beyond the Weymouth Borough boundary stone. From this point the route passes a large holiday camp and on through scrubland to Osmington Mills.
